definitions.definition: The act of neglecting to perform an action one has an obligation to do.
examples: E&O insurance (for errors and omissions) covers both errors of commission and errors of omission .

definitions.definition: An instance of those acts, or the thing left out thereby; something deleted or left out.
examples: The suspicious omissions in the new edition of the book attracted claims of censorship.
The lack of a sponge count was an omission by the surgical team.

definitions.definition: The shortening of a word or phrase , using an apostrophe ( ' ) to replace the missing letters, often used to approximate the sound of speech or a specific dialect .

secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) The act of neglecting to perform an action one has an obligation to do.
( countable ) An instance of those acts, or the thing left out thereby; something deleted or left out.
( grammar ) The shortening of a word or phrase , using an apostrophe ( ' ) to replace the missing letters, often used to approximate the sound of speech or a specific dialect .
